instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display issues
threads.message:
good day, guys, have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that works okay, but when it goes to sleep, the machine would not display unless the battery is disconnected and reconnected, though the trackpad would be active during this time. even when I attempt to forcefully shut the machine down, it does not respond until I disconnect the battery, then the machine would work again until the same thing would happen. 

please help, I don't know what to do from here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display issues
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset first.
And check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> signals.
